Serve this alongside any grilled meat or fish, but it was developed to go with this Pork Tenderloin. This recipe is from B’s Cracklin’ BBQ in Savannah, GA. Read more about pitmaster Bryan Furman here.IngredientsMakes 1 cup2large ripe peaches, peeled, cut into small pieces¼cup ketchup3Tbsp. Dijon mustard1tsp. light brown sugar½tsp. freshly ground black pepper½tsp. (or more) kosher saltPreparationStep 1Purée peaches, ketchup, mustard, brown sugar, pepper, and ½ tsp. salt in a blender until mixture is smooth and creamy. Taste sauce and season with more salt if needed.Step 2Do Ahead: Sauce can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.How would you rate Peach-Mustard Barbecue Sauce?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (2)Back to TopTriangleOur peaches weren't at peak-flavor yet, leaving my sauce a bit flavorless. I threw in a couple tablespoons of strawberry preserves to add some fruity sweetness as well as half cup of bourbon and then put it on the stove for a couple minutes to cook off the strong alcohol taste. Very good! Would definitely make again!Chicago6/29/2020Peach BBQ sauces are fantastic, everyone should try one.
